com.cyc.kb.config

Class KBAPIConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.kb.config.KBAPIConfiguration

  • public class KBAPIConfiguration
extends Object
    A class to hold the configuration parameters such as, transcript flag, current cyclist and current project. A cleaner configuration project is being worked on. This class will be deprecated by that in the next few months.

        Parameters:

      • getShouldTranscriptOperations

        public static boolean getShouldTranscriptOperations()
        Will actions in the current thread that modify the KB be transcripted by the Cyc server?
        Returns:
        will KB operations from the current thread be transcripted?

      • getCurrentCyclist

        public static KBIndividual getCurrentCyclist()
        The Cyclist or the program running on behalf of the cyclist generating the operations in this thread. Return null if not set of if there is any exception.
        Returns:
        the cyclist or the program running on behalf of a cyclist, that is generating the operations in this thread

      • setCurrentCyclist

        public static KBIndividual setCurrentCyclist(KBIndividualImpl cyclist)
        Declare that KB operations performed in this thread were done by the user cyclist. The user could be an individual #$Cyclist or an instance of #$ComputerUser, such as, (UserOfProgramFn CycBrowser CAEUser). Applications written on top of KB API should login an user and create an instance of UserOfProgramFn, based on the application and the user. This will set #$myCreator for constants and :ASSERT-INFO for assertions
        Parameters:
        cyclist - the person or program creating constants and assertions
        Returns:
        the back cyclist set

      • setCurrentCyclist

        public static KBIndividual setCurrentCyclist(String cyclistStr)
        Declare that KB operations performed in this thread were done by the user cyclistStr. The user could be an individual #$Cyclist or an instance of #$ComputerUser, such as, (UserOfProgramFn CycBrowser CAEUser). Applications written on top of KB API should login an user and create an instance of UserOfProgramFn, based on the application and the user. This will set #$myCreator for constants and :ASSERT-INFO for assertions
        Parameters:
        cyclistStr - string representation of the cyclist creating constants and assertions
        Returns:
        the Cyclist created based on cyclistStr

      • setProject

        public static void setProject(KBIndividual project)
                       throws Exception
        Declare that the KB operations performed in this thread are related to the specified project. The project should be an instance of #$Cyc-BasedProject. Applications written on top of KB API should set the purpose on their own or by asking the user at login time. Sets the #$myCreationPurpose for constants and :ASSERT-INFO for assertions.
        Parameters:
        project - an instance of #$Cyc-BasedProject
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getProject

        public KBIndividual getProject()
        Get the project that the KB operations performed in this thread are related to. The project will be an instance of #$Cyc-BasedProject. Return null if unknown or if there is any exception.
        Returns:
        the project related to the current run of the program
